Reviews.Title: “Excellent city hotel which is chic, clean and very comfy”
Reviews.Author: annieDoncaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights would have loved to stay longer. A very chic modern hotel which is near to the Amstel station. The reception area is lovely with very friendly staff who could not do enough to help in relation to nearby restaurants all of which we tried and were very very pleased with.The rooms were very spacious, clean and the beds so comfy.... Well done. A very friendly hotel would visit again....

Reviews.Title: “Good, even if spartan”
Reviews.Author: xx1xx
Reviews.Content: On first sight, the room appeared spartan and bare but it had all that was necessary and more than a lot of other hotels have. Bed was extremely comfortable and the room was bright and well serviced. There was a fridge and kettle and safe. Bathroom was clean. Location is good for transport links (Amstel station) - rail, metro, tram line 12. The area isn't much to look at but my room had a good view over the canal to a prettier place. There were sufficient food outlets, etc around the station. Staff were friendly and a good standard (although I did have to press the doorbell for a couple of minutes when I returned after door locking time). My main negative was that although the room was a good temperature for sleep, it was a little cool for sitting around in. The thermostat was showing maximum but maybe it was switched off somewhere. I wasn't in the room for long periods other than sleep time so I didn't inquire about how to increase the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new and clean”
Reviews.Author: Aji L
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very clean and modern, we believe it is brand new or newly renovated. despite of its distance to city center, it is very close to tram and train station. will stay there again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Near the Metro Station”
Reviews.Author: Azranan
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable hotel, just right for my family of 3. Hotels in Amsterdam central are very expensive, so we opted for this one, 5 stops away from Amsterdam Central Metro station. It is located in a business district area, so it is very safe at night. Rooms are spacious and clean,with nice and simple decor. Basic needs are met. There's a kettle, safe, and a fridge. The bed is very comfortable. My family and I slept fitfully for that 2 nights. Room temperature setting was easy to adjust and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gabor274887
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in the hotel on a business trip to Amsterdam.First its location in Amstel seemed to be quite far from the center.We found however that the metro station is only at 5 minutes walk what is not bad at all. Besides the hotel rents bikes what is also a great way to get to the centre. Otherwise the area does not offer many attractions.It also looks that there are contructions nearby and the hotel can be noisier in the mornings.Fortunately we did not experience it during our stay. The room is rather large compared to the average Amsterdam hotel rooms although still modest in size.It was clean and looked like freshly renovated.Free wifi is available in the whole building. The staff was friendly and helpful. It is also important that the hotel has a garage what is almost impossible to get at a hotel closer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good”
Reviews.Author: Matzanmat
Reviews.Content: I was here with my wife and 3 year old son for 2 nights, a week ago. Hotel is just walking distance away from Amstel train station (5 stops away from Amsterdam train station). Friendly and helpful staff and generally nice, quiet ambience. Only thing is the carpet was hard, but it doesn't matter to me or my family.

Reviews.Title: “ok for quick trip”
Reviews.Author: fw37
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night when visiting to see Kasabian at Heineken music Hall.Dead comfy bed and clean rooms with modern bathrooms.Breakfast was average and not really replenished enough but we were hungover so it was ok..Really good transport links to town and HMH.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall”
Reviews.Author: Theogeor
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a night at the Casa 400 hotel in late January (had to move the day after due to availability) and I was very pleased with the hotel. The hotel looks modern and clean with good check in service . Rooms are good size with all amenities needed when on a business trip. Breakfast was also good with a good selection of both cold and hot options. Also tried the restaurant during the day. While food quality was good and had no complains about the service the menu could have been better and I would say that is the area that can improve.

Reviews.Title: “Modern but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: GlobalguyOttawa
Reviews.Content: Good value if you have business near Amstel station otherwise a bit of a long walk to Ams sights.

Reviews.Title: “best sleeping quality in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: laz81
Reviews.Content: A great, no frills hotel. Stayed here for 3 nights during February and had a very good experience. The room is modern, kind of minimalist, but it makes it very comfortable. Had probably the best sleeping quality ever in a hotel. The bed is king size and mattress is perfect. Hotel even provides ear plugs in case the constructions around disturb you in the morning. This wasnt the case, maybe due to the freezing temperature. Staff was very helpful advsing us on how to get round. Locationwise it is also convenient. Amstel station is 3 min away, also at first hte hotel was a bit difficult to find. From Amstel its about 5-10 min to get anywhere where you need to go in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: MedTravellerUk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Casa400 last week (8-10 Feb) as part of a group business booking. The hotel is clean, modern and comfortable. My room was warm despite the freezing temperatures outside. The hotel is well located for Amstel station (though not that easy to find). We ate in the restaurant as a large group and the food is of a good standard. The bar during busy times seems understaffed but the hotel staff work hard and provide an efficient service. I had a good stay and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good enough and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: HaPi_42
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, not in Amsterdam centre but certainly not far from it and very close to all sorts of public transport. The rooms are not too big, but comfortable (I had a one-person room). Best of all is the price. For Amsterdam standards this is cheap. Internet is free (cable or wireless). One minor point which may not be relevant for others: while I was there the outside temperature was about -10Celsius. The heating couldn't keep up with that, so the room was comfortable to sleep in (about 15 or 16?). I can imagine you'd not want to sit and watch tv in that. It was good enough for me, and most of the year it probably won't matter.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: iandScotland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Cassa400 for a five day break in Feb 2012 and can't say enough good things about the place. The staff are cheerful, helpful, all speak good english and are happy to help in any way. we have stayed all over the world and have yet to find a better hotel. The rooms are large, well lit and even provide a safe in your room. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. As for the comments by 'serious traveller 01', I don't know what hotel he stayed in but it sure as hell wasn't The Cassa 400 in Amsterdam, because there is plenty of room for cases (we had 4 large cases, two smaller cases, and a couple of holdalls). as for the bath room the shower is good the mirror is positioned above the sink (where does he want the mirror to be, on the ceiling?!).

Reviews.Title: “a modern 3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeriousTraveller01
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve visited Amsterdam about 20 times. Given the TripAdvisor reviews I had high expectations but was disappointed. The room and bathroom were basic, very little space on the floor in the bedroom for a suitcase; the bathroom had lighting and a mirror but neither was well positioned for shaving. The shower lacked water pressure to the extent that only 30% of my body could get under the water at one time â€“ Iâ€™m an average size. Around the plastic hand basin were two cigarette butt burn marks (room 625); I appreciate they are not the fault of the hotel but they need to be sanded and polished out; there were no tissues. Trams run near the hotel for much of the night; whilst the hotel appears new and has double glazing the soundproofing (perhaps in the walls) is insufficient such that you can hear the rumble as trams pass by. A new multi storey building is being built next door and the hotel has thoughtfully put foam ear plugs in the bedrooms to minimise that disturbance â€“ Iâ€™d asked for a quiet room but needed the earplugs to shut out the noise of the trams â€“ when one earplug came out during the night I woke up and had to put it back in before I could sleep again. I booked via hotels.com and paid UKÂ£110.96 however on arrival I was advised by the hotel that a local Amsterdam tourist tax was not included â€“ after they had checked internally I was forced to pay this additional tax. I took exception to this additional charge of 4.60 euros as my receipt listed â€œTaxes and Feesâ€� and quoted a â€œTotal Priceâ€�. In my view it is not acceptable to quote a total price, bank the money and then for the customer to be hit with an additional unexpected charge that was not previously mentioned. The front desk personnel were polite and helpful but lacked the authority to correct this basic problem. The staff in the restaurant plentiful but spent their time talking amongst themselves instead of providing a good service. The food in the restaurant was OK but not cheap â€“ a one course club sandwich lunch with soft drinks and coffee came to 18 euros each. The free Wi-Fi worked well and the bed was comfortable but at UKÂ£115 for one night, room only, in early February in a suburb of Amsterdam did not to me represent good value for money; 85 euros / Â£70 would in my view have been more appropriate

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable working stay”
Reviews.Author: JWoolsey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while working just outside Amsterdam and found my stay very comfortable. Great sized rooms, really well cleaned and maintained and very modern. The staff were always friendly and willing to help with anything needed during my stay. Food was very good and cheap which for Amsterdam I found to be quite surprising. Yes a little away from the main city/town, however the price makes up fot this. Not sure its a family type hotel, but more business type, however great hotel and just my opinon. Give it a go, doubt you'll be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent all round”
Reviews.Author: harim
Reviews.Content: Our little family stayed here before Christmas in 2011 for three nights. The first thing that stands out with the hotel is the excellent staff - amazingly efficient, friendly, and genuinely cheerful. Our daughter is 7 years old and we were looking for a location a little away from the bustle of downtown Amsterdam. The hotel is located close to Amstel station - a 10 minute ride from the Central Train Station. We took the train from Schipol airport to Central station. There are excellent train, bus, and metro connections at Amstel station. It is roughly 10 minute walk from Amstel station to the hotel. There aren't any grocery stores next to the hotel, we bought supplies at the little market at Amstel station. The hotel's breakfast was good - a little pricey at 15 euros per person. I highly recommend the hotel and feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: JennyBednarz
Reviews.Content: Probably a bit too far out of town - but the price was affordable. Hotel itself is very large and the rooms nice and big and clean. Very pricey breakfast so we just bought breakfast on the way into town - once we learned not to go into a 'coffee shop'. Walked in the first day - too far. Train is only five minutes away and proved the best way to get around. We did a couple of half day tours and were able to be picked up from Casa which was good. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Casa 400 - Modern and Clean”
Reviews.Author: MGBaltz
Reviews.Content: + Great hotel to stay in Amsterdam. Modern structure and furniture, very confort bed and wonderfully clean. - A bit far from downtown, but the subway is reasonably close to the hotel and easy to ride. *I recommend this hotel for anyone. No doubts.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT! Even being out of the city center.”
Reviews.Author: PedroCapellao
Reviews.Content: Great acomodation, great staff! Casa400 is the perfect hotel to anyone who looks for style, comfort and an incredible time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but poor breakfast and no AC only fans”
Reviews.Author: Mgamal
Reviews.Content: Amazing experience, very clean, friendly staff, not that cheap, poor breakfast I would go back again ay time! 4 minutes walk from Amstel station!!

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: trigglett
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little out of town but great value and the train runs to within 5 minutes walk away.Beds comfortable tea making facilities and fridge.There were some building works going on next door, but even tho we were supplied with ear plugs we didn't need themAll in all we would stay hear again happilly..

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: TriciaandDave
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superb! The staff were so friendly and helpful and the hotel was spotless - well done cleaning staff! The hotel was also excellent value for money. We got a taxi from Central Station on arrival which cost 20 euros but the next day bought a metro/bus/tram pass at 11.50 euros each that lasted us on countless journeys over the next two days. Buy one! And the metro is literally a 3min walk from the hotel! We even wheeled our luggage across on the last day it was so near. We had an evening meal on the first day which was real cordon en bleu but I would have appreciated more contrasting flavours to compliment the delicious handmade spinach and goats cheese canneloni. But that is nitpicking. The handmade chocolates for desert were out of this world. The chef is obviously very talented. Yes, I would most definitely go back. The hotel was excellent value and - for us - really peaceful. I know there is building work going on but hardly the hotel's fault. And in a city you would expect some background noise. Our only gripe would be the breakfast staff. They were so busy chatting to each other that we ended up clearing our own plates to a nearby table to make room and the plates were cold which meant the cooked breakfast was rather unpleasant towards the end. I know I am short (5ft) but I couldn't even find - let alone reach - the butters and spreads as they were placed so high up on a shelf - also the sauces for the cooked breakfast were almost impossible to reach. Why? This facility certainly did not match up to the rest of the hotel. But as breakfast is optional this is no big deal. But well done Casa 400. We thoroughly enjoyed our fist trip to Amsterdam and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “3 stars hotel service”
Reviews.Author: Pollylau
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to stay in hotel casa 400. The hotel is clean and modern, but those staffs are not very helpful and friendly. Location is far away from the airport. I booked a shuttle bus to the airport in the morning of the day i left, but the staff told me they forgot my booking one and half hour before my flight. At the end, i need to rush to the airport with my heavy luggages.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but hard to locate”
Reviews.Author: Viviene T
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel is good, place was clean and comfortable. Located near train station. Except for a few improvement area. The hotel was quite hidden without clear sign showing where it's located. Due to it's behind some tall buildings we couldn't see it and there was no obvious signs showing where it is. During our stay there, we came across another 2 travelers who was having hard time locating it as well. Reception was abit slow. we had quite a long wait at the reception due to only 2 staffs were handling the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, quiet and only a couple Euros to Central Station”
Reviews.Author: Kori_8
Reviews.Content: I ticked the wrong box and selected a twin room when I booked on line, so I called and asked to change this to a double, two weeks later I called to confirm and the booking hadn't yet been corrected, but the staff were quick to resolve this the second time around and let us have a room with a view over the canal which was beautiful. The staff are honest, friendly and helpful, the premises are lovely and the rooms are clean. While at the airport I realised that I had left things in the bedside draws, the staff found these for me and kept them in the reception safe so I could hurry back to collect them. We had a fantastic time and I would happily recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A good value stay”
Reviews.Author: GattsAuckland
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Casa 400. It is modern, clean hotel but seems a bit clinical. it is handy to the Metro and it is easy to get into the centre although it is not on a direct line from the airport so we needed to go into the city first and then back to the hotel although it was not too difficult. The hotel was good value and met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “New, nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnikaFC
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. restaurant i 1floor is very nice, where can spend the evening and then go to sleep. Restaurant i possible to warm your own food if u want and they have table for that where you can eat after heating you food. i did notused that but i saw people doing it. to heat your food is important, because many people want eat sometimes something else, not only restaurant. area in nice, litlle bit away from center, but it is very quiet area to sleep and stay. i liked and i recommend to go.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel in a quiet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Mihirgandhi
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were good, the rooms were modern, however had one bad incident, there was a bunch of guys knocking on my door at 4am in the morning,I had to get up from my sleep and tell them to go away...

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and modern”
Reviews.Author: Losmithyz88
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. Modern rooms, the staff were very nice and helpful and the housekeeping were good too. Very close to Amstel station and was generally easy to find. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Far From the Noise”
Reviews.Author: Bhupendraa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights during my trip to Amsterdam. A newly built hotel with a big and impressive reception and modern architecture. The distance from city centre keeps the room rent at moderate levels in comparison to the fescilities. The metro and train station is a 10 minutes walk so if you do not mind this much walking it is a very good choice away from crowded city centre. Rooms are moderate sized and very comfertable beds. Bathrooms ,too, are of moderate size but everything is clean and tidy. I did not take breakfast in the hotel so can not comment on the quality of it. One drawback of this hotel is lack of any good restaurant or eating joint or grocery shop in the vicinity. The nearest happening place is the metro station. So if you want a reasonably priced comfortable accomodation in Amsterdam and not visiting the city for the first time for sightseeing, Casa 400 is a very good option. The first time visitors might like to find a suitable hotel inthe city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Casa 400”
Reviews.Author: wendyann1967
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Casa 400 hotel on the 19th November 2011, we had an excellent stay, the room was clean and large. There were tea and coffee making facilities and a hair dryer in the modern and spacious bathroom. Free wifi in the room and throughout the hotel, and easy check in. We could not fault the hotel or facilities at all and wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tuan O
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying in this hotel and I can say its nice to have a repeat experience. Arriving at the hotel, (about 10 mins from Centraal Station by taxi) you come into a Modern and bright hotel. Staff at reception are efficient and frinedly and the rooms are great. Great size bed with a high ceiling, airy, bright and warm...love the bathroom, convienient and nice shower cabin. Breakfast has a great choice but mainly geared for continentals with cheese, ham and breads.....self service and coffee machine on hand with good quality coffee. We had dinner and it was superb. The reception informed me the chef was a finalist on a Dutch TV cooking programme and he certainly gave us a great meal. I had a seabass starter whcih was coated ina salted vermicelli and some green asparagus tips to dress, excellent and all those in the group had similar excellent starters. My main course was a wild mushroom risotto and the seasoning was perfect. To finish a fig mille feuille and ice cream, delicous. Service was professional and very hospitable. The bar was fine, its on the 1st floor and a cosy atmosphere with a good selection of beers and drinks...bar staff friendly and efficient. Overall a great hotel, not pricey for Amsterdam standards and we had a rate of 125 euros including breakfast......so recommend this hotel and hope to go back soon. There are building works outside as the Amsterdam municipal are doing works and the hotel has notices in every room and they also provide ear plugs.........:) Otherwise great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent conference venue, 20 min from Schipol by public transportation”
Reviews.Author: CyberSurrealist
Reviews.Content: Modern and convenient venue for holding a seminar, WIFI all around the hotel, professional service- well delivered service, nice food (nothing extravagant), new rooms and interior. Next to the hotel was a construction site. It really disturbed good night sleep. However, it was nice that the hotel apologized for the noise by leaving earplugs with a little note by the bed. The location is OK, not exactly at the center, but very near. Its possible to walk from the center to the hotel along the beautiful Amstel canal. The hotel is very near to Amstel station (3 minutes walk). It took us only 20 minutes to get there from Schipol - few stops by train and few stops by tube.

Reviews.Title: “good as it be”
Reviews.Author: vanhiephoang
Reviews.Content: Staff is rude and not very helpful. Arrogant for doing nothing. Lasting impression were extremely poor- rubbish checking out system; never seen such organision! Absolutely no remorse from staff, probably due to them being so confused by their checking out system! Might have been a different story if we were in our other very normal car, as undoubtedly this would have had substantial damage! Good first impression. Turned up early to be allowed to check in- room clean n bed comfy- adequate bathroom. Not 1.9km from city- don't know how far but took us 1 hour to walk there and 1 hour to walk back, and noone tell us that there is a train nearby!

Reviews.Title: “3 star experience”
Reviews.Author: Teemu_The_Finn
Reviews.Content: Hotel Is very smart and functional. Perhaps a bit clinical, Scandinavian feel is the right way to describe it. Taxi from the airport is around 45 Euros but train is an option to Amstel station. Great location near Amsterdam Amstel train station (5min). It takes max.15 minutes to the down town but there are also lots to see at Amstel area. Unfortunately the nearest mall is quite far. Staff was friendly. Rooms were clean. During my stay, hotel provided to guests free earplugs. Yes, you read it right. They gave to customers 2 pairs to avoid noise from the construction site next to the hotel. WiFi is free and fast and TV works properly. Ice is available on every floor which is nice w/ drinks. I stayed for business and our conference was held in Casa400.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Sandersmits
Reviews.Content: Stunning, Nice room, great staff! Good breakfast with a lot of fresh fruit! We Will be back

Reviews.Title: “Superb three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sjurontour
Reviews.Content: I am impressed by this three star product. Friendly and knowledgeable people behind the front desk. Minimalistic, light and bright public areas, a nice restaurant which also is used for breakfast and superb conference rooms. My room was specious and had all the things I need; a clean an practical bathroom, a huge and very comfortable bed and free WiFi. The hotel is located just outside the centre but with excellent connections with public transportation to the rest of Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel from its very start”
Reviews.Author: Luca V
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in its opening days (May 2010) and it was a very good choice. Very good staff, great rooms, just some minutes by metro from the downtown. Loved particularly the HUGE desk all along the wall. Definitely one of the best choices you can make if you want to visit Amsterdam. While most of the downtown hotels don't even have one bathroom per room, in Casa 400 the bathroom was almost the size of my entire parisian flat. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: boazsharon
Reviews.Content: Average hotel. Average rooms. Free Internet. Convenient public transportation access. Location is approximately 3km from the city center. Around the hotel there is nothing to do. Stuff are helpful, but sometimes need to wait few minutes until they are vacant. Parking is 17.5 Euros, but from 9pm till 9am there are free parking outside.

Reviews.Title: “clean but very basic”
Reviews.Author: michealCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: this a very basic overpriced hotel in the middle of nowhere. No character. You wouldn't know that you were in Amsterdam, Holland or even Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Spartan, but clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Scalarnet
Reviews.Content: A good hotel located close to the Amstel station so access into central Amsterdam is convenient. Rooms are spartan, but clean. Excellent wifi available in hotel and a good breakfast was available. I was there for a conference so it was not a hotel I would normally have picked. If you need a hair dryer, ask for it when you get there. It is a first-come, first-serve basis.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for groups”
Reviews.Author: Enjoystour
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3-nights a group of 90 of us on a business conference. Rooms were spacious with good view & really clean & hygienic. Breakfast spread was good & elaborate but the items remained the same on all our 3 breakfasts. Conference halls was prearranged as per our earlier communication & all the basic facilities required was present to successfully organise the conference. Will recommend to groups as well as families.

Reviews.Title: “Best quality/price”
Reviews.Author: SirDemian
Reviews.Content: the position can scare if you don't already know the city because it seems to be very far from the downtown, but is linked to city center with every pubblic transport (bus, metro and train) and reachable in max 15 minutes. the structure is very modern and absolutely clean. wi-fi connection is good in all hotel areas. the staff is very professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for business trip”
Reviews.Author: skyriazakos
Reviews.Content: Trendy, nice n easy location, clean and good sleeping quality

Reviews.Title: “Soulless, but otherwise functional, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: LongTalker
Reviews.Content: The outside view of this hotel is nothing less than an eye-sore to look at, however once you're inside you'll find yourself in a very modern and functional hotel. The rooms are very clean and well-equipped, although oddly enough, a few essential bits were missing such as a mirror inside or next to the wardrobe. Again, "soulless" is the best way to describe the rooms as well as the hotel overall. The lighting in the rooms is particularly cold and harsh. Also, the view from any of the rooms is not likely to impress anyone. A small but annoying inconvenience is that the curtains are not long enough to cover the entire window, which means you will have to be rise and shine early in the morning, whether you want to or not. I'm sure those reading are already aware of the less-than-ideal location, so overall this hotel is just a (decent) place to rest after a busy day in Amsterdam, and one to quickly get away from in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl2578437
Reviews.Content: Great location near Amsterdam Amstel train station and a good but expensive place to eat. Staff wasn't super friendly. Rooms were clean, floor was some odd carpet that I thought was cork flooring at first. Not really comfortable on your feet. Air conditioning isn't that great (it could only be raised or lowered by 3 degrees. Construction going on next door, which the hotel can't help, but they did provide ear plugs in each room.

Reviews.Title: “Our car and another five cars got broken into, won't be coming back”
Reviews.Author: M M
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately our car and another 5 five cars got broken into. We paid for privilege of having our car secured in the hotel underground car parking yet it got broken into. They have security cameras all over the place, I wonder how this happened?, We were given our room back for the rest of the day but they wanted us to leave ASAP, never mind you and your family traveling all the way back to your home country with a provisional window glass. Won't be coming back. Very bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: Anne187350
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite new, so the interior is modern and clean, although perhaps a bit impersonal, like moderne hotels are. The staff at reception were very friendly and helpful, and spoke excelent English and German. The twiin room was quite spacious and the beds very comfortable. A the free wifi worked without any problems. The breakfast buffet was OK, but a little bit too expensive (it may be possible to get a discount by ordering in advance). However, my colleague and I also had dinner in the restaurant downstairs, and the evening food was very nice, good service and that was not expensive, but good value for money. The location of the hotel is also quite convenient. Five minutes wlak from the Amstel station, which is easy to reach from the Airport, and with good train, bus and metro connections to the town centre.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, with small inconvenient problms...”
Reviews.Author: Anna k
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the hotel for 6 nights, the room is very compact and nice. The staff was nice and helpful. The hotel is located far from the center, but you can take public transportation from the station next to the hotel and get to the center of the city in 15 minutes. The breakfast was fine, however the diversity wasnâ€™t bigâ€¦ the food itself was nice. Now (end of August) there was construction site next to the hotel, so the hotel supplied us ear plugs, which was very caring even though we didnâ€™t hear any noise from inside the room (the construction site was in front of our room). The shower was problematic, the water leaked from the shower to the floor and it was all wet for long time (why they didn't put something that will close the gap between the shower doors? That could solve the problemâ€¦) the water pressure was very low and inconvenient. Also were some problems with the clean towels one day, when it wasn't cleanâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Bad lasting impression- car park barriar fell onto our roof and security gate closed into our bonnet!”
Reviews.Author: Rapunzelshair
Reviews.Content: Good first impression. Turned up early to be allowed to check in- room clean n bed comfy- adequate bathroom. Not 1.9km from city- don't know how far but took us 1 hour to walk there and 1 hour to walk back- next day took train- would have been helpful if they had told us the station was only 3 mins away! Anyway- each time a door near our room closed the window and our door rattled! Lasting impression were extremely poor- rubbish checking out system; never seen such disorganision! â‚¬35 for car parking- not too bad- however we were lucky we had roll cage and bull bars as the barrier came down on our roof and Gaye closed on what would be anyone else's bonnet! Abousoletly no remorse from staff, probably due to them being so confused by their checking out system! Might have been a different story if we were in our other very normal car, as undoubtedly this would have had substantial damage! We won't go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Good Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sunova
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night as part of tour in car with friends Room was modern and had everything we needed, free wi-fi Self service breakfast, hotel was busy but there was a good choice of food which the staff kept topped up Short walk to metro, but was closed due to engineering work but extra buses were laid on to Amsterdam Centre Underground car park was good As a footnote, we had left cooler box on in car so flat battery the next morning We has taken AA European Cover, excellent service, guy arrived in 30 minutes to jump start us,

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a bit far from the city centre”
Reviews.Author: MsCherryWaves
Reviews.Content: This is definitively a good place to stay. It's clean, comfortable and quiet. I had absolutely no trouble at all and staff was very nice. Even when I forgot the key (card) at the room, they solved the problem in less than 5 min. Really comfortable bed. Big TV on the room with a lot of international TV channels (unfortunately no portuguese TV channels). Free wifi internet in the room. The standard rooms didn't have hairdryer, but there were some available at the reception. CONS: it's far from the centre. The train, metro and bus station are pretty close, though (5 min walk). It's about 10 min from the centre (or ~20 min in rush hour) by bus. I don't know how long it would take by metro, because the metro was under maintenance and it was closed. The access from the station to the hotel is poorly lit at night, I felt it was a bit unsafe, but nothing happened to me during all my stay. Don't forget the 5% city tax over your reservation. Tip: breakfast is an extra and costs 15â‚¬. They have a small shop at the reception with fruit, pastry and juices. A bit expensive, so I'd recommend the Albert Heijn supermarket at Amstel station as alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and bright!”
Reviews.Author: Stefciu
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel in the outskirts of Amsterdam. 10 mins by bike from the city centre or 3 mins on foot from Amstel metro/train station. Staff very friendly. The breakfast is a bit expensive in my opinion (15 Euro/person). They do have a nice bar, very professional with a large range of cocktails and others; and also a restaurant that i didn't have the time to try. Wifi free and that's a very good point too! Definitely will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “About hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra D
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very very good and the services too. But you cant smoke in the hotel or your room, you must go outside the hotel, that was not good for me! But is a very clean hotel and brautifull. You can go easy to the center of Amsterdam with bus 59. The Amstel station as near by and there is a bus every 5 min.

Reviews.Title: “good for some nights”
Reviews.Author: alvincenthanoi
Reviews.Content: I stayed on this Hotel for 3 nights. The hotel looks modern superficially. But the service and breakfast in particular are in big question mark. My bed sheets were not changed, the room was not cleaned very well. As this hotel caters for large overseas bus groups there were long time consuming lines at reception. The hotel is a long way from the city centre, only one restaurant nearby, so your only option is to take the metro to get anywhere. Fortunately, the metro is 5 minutes away.Casa 400 has a business model: rooms appear as cheap when you want to book, but you have to take into account that breakfast is not included (â‚¬15). Want to have your breakfast in the vicinity? Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel Thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: yotsmn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 nights at the Casa 400. On arrival, it was raining, and we didn't know what to think about the hotel location. It seemed to be somewhat isolated. However, as we began to explore the surroundings we were pleased with our choice. The Amstel Canal and Station were both within about a 5 minute walk and there was a large supermarket a comfortable 15 min walk away. There was only one restaurant in the immediate vicinity but others could be reached on foot in 10 -15 minutes. There was also a restaurant in the hotel which looked quite nice but we didn't eat there. We regularly walked into the city and back along the canal which was very scenic and took about 50 minutes each way. From Amstel to central station was a 7 minute ride. The hotel also had bicycles for hire for $EU13 daily. As for the hotel itself: Pros: - As stated we liked the location being outside the main city area but still easily accessible via train or casual walk along the Amstel Canal - Very professional, friendly and informative reception staff - Hotel is near new and the room was quite spacious and well appointed - Lovely bathroom and great hot shower - FREE WIFI in room - Mini bar, safe and plenty of wardrobe space - Comfy beds and good block out curtains CONS: - the hotel was just off the map provided by the hotel. It would have been nice to have had a map showing hotel location as well as the location of supermarkets and Restaurants in the vicinity

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it like the Plague!”
Reviews.Author: 255100Max
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in June. I'll start with the positives. It is a modern hotel with spacious rooms. However we encountered a number of problems whilst we were there. Firstly, we had booked a Double room and had a condirmation in our hand yet reception would only give us gave us a Twin Bedroom. As this hotel caters for large overseas bus groups there were long time consuming lines at reception. The hotel is a long way from the city centre, only one restaurant nearby, so your only option is to take the metro to get anywhere. Fortunately, the metro is 5 minutes away.Perhaps the biggest problem of all was the building works going on next door. The noise would start early in the morning and continue into the late afternoon. A lot of Loud pounding and banging. There was a huge crane on the building site so it appears the building works will continue for some time yet. We were disappointed with this hotel as it was our first time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and cheerful hotel with great travel connections”
Reviews.Author: lecbruce
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is a great city but finding good quality and reasonably priced hotels is somewhat of a lottery. The Hotel Casa 400 is a funky and cheerful hotel with excellent travel connections and located near the canals. The hotel is located near to Amstel station with good metro, train and tram connections. Be warned the hotel is next to a building site which has another six months of build work. However in the three times I have stayed at the hotel there has been no noise or disturbance. The hotel staff are very helpful and there average 3-4 staff at the front reception so there are never any long queues. The rooms are space and bright. I had problems with shower but this was quickly resolved after I compliand. My factor is the location. I am a runner and there are lots of paths and canals that allows for long and pleasant training runs.

Reviews.Title: “Peace outside the craziness of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: hfriday
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in July and picked it because it was close enough to the center, great price for a new and modern hotel and because of the good reviews on TripAdvisor. We were pleased with the hotel - it's clean, simple and the staff were great! The staff were very friendly and helpful. They offered very useful information about getting around and helped us print out our museum tickets we purchased online. I can't comment much on breakfast since we opted to eat outside the hotel as we do when we travel. One thing that bothered me about the hotel was that although there seemed to be a thermostat for cool/hot air it was not working. Being a typical European hotel room, it's not the most spacious and the only window was a very narrow window that only allowed a slit to open. That barely gave way for some ventilation and I felt claustrophobic at times. The train station is quite close but maybe not close enough for my liking. After a long day of walking and touring, I wished the station was a little closer! The Amstel station had food outlets and stores that will cater to whatever you need. It's a great hotel if you want to be away from the crazy action in center of town at the end of the day. But if you want to stay out late and be in the life of the party, you may want something closer. I would recommend it for those that are in Amsterdam for reasons other than the party life or for families.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Ovemunk
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed on the hotel for 4 days and we were quite satisfyed. the hotel is modern and the staff is very helpfull. There are fine (if expensive) parking facilities and the room was good, roomy, well equipped and with a very fine bathroom. I missed an electric kettle and some Tea/coffee though.. The beds are very hard but big and there are a fine TV with lots of different channels also some English. The breakfast is WAY too expensive but you can buy coffe/bread from a stall in the reception or you can walk to the Railway station (Amstel 5min. away) where you also can get a decent breakfast. It is easy to get into town from Amstel Station where you can catch both Tram and Metro. You can buy passes for 1-2-3-4-5 days which allows you to use Tram/Bus/Metro and it is a cheap way to explore the town. The longest wait we had for a Tram was 8 min. There are free LAN internet connection which works excellent.

Reviews.Title: “well worth it”
Reviews.Author: mrskbaker
Reviews.Content: we atayed here last weekend 16-19th july for my 30th birthday as we were going to Take That (which by the way was excellent). The day before we flew out I emailed the gotel to ask if we could get tino our room early as we had an early flight to which they replied avising that if a room was avilable we could have one early otherwise they had storage facilities for us to store luggage until a room became available so that we could explore. We flew into Scipol arriving just after 8 in the morning and headed for tourist information where we were warmly greeted and received excellent direction as to how to get to the hotel, very simple by train with one change. They also told us how we could get back to the airport using the night bus service (we flew out at 6) which again was very easy. The hotel is very close to amstel station, though its not obvious when you come out onto the street, however ask anyone and you'll be pointed in the right dirction. First impressions of the hotel, it looed huge, bright neon lights outside but definitely not in a scenic position. The staff were friendly and we booked in very easily with access to our room. There is a 5% tax payable to the hotel if not included in your price at time of booking. The elevators to the rooms worked once you had swiped your room key, this was a nice safety feature. The room itself I thought was great value, huge comfortable bed, flatscreen tv which worked great for charging our phones as we'd forgotten adaptors, a mini fridge and clean modern bathroom with consistantly hot water. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on that though the menu looked decent but not much variation. Perhaps my only gripe would be that the walls are paper thin which for the most part isn't a problem, unless its 5 am and your neighbours decide to party...however a quick phonecall to reception sorted that in minutes. All in all I would recommend this place and would have no hesitation in returning there again if we visited Amsterdam again

Reviews.Title: “New, Modern, Very nice”
Reviews.Author: droideka27
Reviews.Content: We were vacationing in Germany and decided to make the first weekend a trip to the Netherlands (only stayed one night). This hotel is new, nice, had an ice machine, AC, and a portable fan for the room - all of which were appreciated since we visited in the summer. The hotel is close by the train station (few minute walk). We took the public transportation to the central station but then decided just to walk all the way back to the hotel (~3 miles) while exploring the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, just a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Kyla64
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find (we were driving) it has a ample underground parking, at a rate of 18 euro's per 24 hours, which is much cheaper than most of the hotels. The rooms are spacious and clean, albeit basic. The hotel is a reasonable distance from the centre of Amsterdam however there is a train/tram station nearby (costing ~7 euro return, dependant on ime of travel). A taxi (one way) into Dam Square costs 14 euros. We didnt book breakfast, however intended to use the facility but upon arrival at the breakfast area the queue on both days was at least a 30 minute wait. We ate in the restaurant in the evening which was very expensive, with the average main course costing 16 euros. The hotel is clean, staff are efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Mala-od-palube
Reviews.Content: Casa 400 is not in the very city center, but it is 3 minute walk away from the train station. Platform 1 is where you would shortly wait for the train to take you to Amsterdam Centraal (again, only minutes away). We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Rooms are clean, not too small, and staff is very helpful. A neat thing they have is a so called taxi voucher from the hotel to the airport, which means that you pay one fixed price for the taxi right there, they give you the voucher, and you give it to your taxi driver. This helps you avoid the possibility of being overcharged for the fare. A highly recommended place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Such a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Greenapplechai
Reviews.Content: We booked Casa 400 online and was surprised our room was so big, clean, quiet and had coffee making facilities. We stayed in the center of Amsterdam for a night and although this isn't near the center (about 5 stops on the the train from Amsterdam Centraal) you get so much more bang for your buck. The staff was amazing, the room was great and I would tell a friend to stay here. Although you do need to take a train to get here (a 2 days tain, tram, buss pass is 11 euro) I think it is worth it compared to the tiny, dirty room we stayed in, in central Amsterdam for the same price. If you are on a budget I would pass on the breakfast in the hotel and just go to the Amstel Station (right across the street) where there is a supermarket as well as other eateries. You can get anything in the small supermarket in there: milk, cereal, bread, sandwich meat, snacks, fruit. There is also a Burger King and a fruit smoothie place which are so much cheaper than the restaurants. Although location wasn't completely ideal I would stay here again and take the train. Coming from NYC I am used t that anyway.

Reviews.Title: “All in all good value”
Reviews.Author: m_m2500
Reviews.Content: As past reviwers have stated, a little out of the hustle & bustle of Central Amsterdam. Not a bad thing. Staff were accommodating and friendly, despite the obvious presures they were confronted with due to the building site opposite. We had booked via booking.com & we opted for an upgrade. By mistake the receptionist gave us the key to a different room (twin rather than double) this room overlooked the building site and the noise, despite complimentary ear plugs would have been quite off putting. The room change went smoothly. There were a couple of other guests requesting room changes at the same time, not sure of out come but I probably wouldn't give too good a review if we had of been in one of those rooms Rooms very clean and comfortable bed. Ate in the restaurant one night. For the price so, so. Would I stay here again, sure but I would check on building development and request a room away from road.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for budget travel, minimalist rooms”
Reviews.Author: pgnpixi
Reviews.Content: We were only in Amsterdam for one night, so we weren't overly concerned with what the hotel would be like. Hotel Casa 400 was a perfectly fine hotel for a one night stay, and would probably also be good for business travel. The staff was friendly, helpful and spoke excellent English. The train, metro and bus station is only a three or four minute walk from the hotel, and the trip to Central Station takes less than 10 minutes. There is on-site, gated parking for 17,50 Euros per day. Our room was minimalist, but brightly colored chairs and brown-padded walls added a nice accent. There was also a large tabletop running along the window that would be great for business. The free Wi-Fi had a strong signal and worked great. The bed was incredibly firm- a little too firm for my taste, but my husband loved it. The aforementioned chairs, however, were horribly uncomfortable- fine enough for sitting it to put on your shoes, but not for long periods of time. The TV was also a little frustrating- it took 3-4 seconds to flip from channel to channel- long enough that you wondered if the TV had gotten the signal or not. The bathroom was lovely- a sizeable counter and a large-for-Europe shower. We were a bit put out when staff entered our room only moments after we'd gotten there. There was a knock and the door, and we were so surprised that it took a moment to get up and open the door; by the time I'd reached it, the staff member was opening the door. He apologized and said they were just checking which rooms were still free. If you're the type of traveler who just uses your room to sleep in, this is a great choice, but if you plan to spend lots of time in your room, you may want to consider somewhere else. We're the former, so if we find ourselves in Amsterdam, we'll probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel , excellent value...”
Reviews.Author: shaste80
Reviews.Content: Went to Amsterdam for the first time this past June and came across this hotel through booking.com We drove from Stuttgart and were looking for hotels that provided secure on-site parking, twin beds and FREE Wi-Fi!!! This hotel is pretty coolâ€¦ I think itâ€™s only a year or two old. I spotted a variety of people staying at the hotel (all ages, all nationalities) so that made me feel like I had picked well â€¦ I prepaid on Booking.com so I had no issue in that area Iâ€™m pretty sure itâ€™s operated in a way thatâ€™s very conscious of energy conservation but not in an annoying, no hot water wayâ€¦. So sometimes when you step into hallways or when you go into the parking garage its pitch black until a sensor turns the lights on so be prepared for thatâ€¦ The room was larger than I expected. The room reminded me of a dorm room but not in a low-budget kinda way. There were plenty of outlets so our gadgets remained juiced up, an in-room fridge and on our floor we even had an ice machine down the hallâ€¦ my friend also made use of the ironing closet near the elevators as there was none in the roomâ€¦ the in-room safe was easy to use and convenientâ€¦ Parking at the hotel was really cool because once you left the parking garage you couldnâ€™t re-enter from the hotel unless you had a parking ticket. That was reassuring because we figured this reduced the amount of opportunists likely to break into the carsâ€¦ Location wise I took the train once from the Amstel station to downtown and that was only 2 euro, Iâ€™ve taken a cab once from the Rembrandt Platz club area and that cost about 10 euroâ€¦ we also strolled towards the downtown area and I think we were there within about an hour. So I would say that while CASA 400 isnâ€™t across the street from the Red Light District & Amsterdam Centraal it also wasnâ€™t a PIA to get to where we wanted is a decent amount of timeâ€¦ Also dined at Circles before driving back to Stuttgart and we were really impressed by the quality of the foodâ€¦ really something for everyone on the menu and it would be great if they offered room service if they donâ€™t alreadyâ€¦ Overall had a really nice stay... will be back when Iâ€™m in town... excellent value considering what we paid for 3 nightsâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but payment process...”
Reviews.Author: Sulamif
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam for 4 days (11-15 june). The hotel is nice - big clean room, quiet place, everything new etc. But I had really terrible situation with payment process!!! I am from Russia, so usually I pay with my bank card via booking.com or hotels.com and there were not any problems with currency conversion. Every organization take money in euro. But the bank of this hotel took money in roubles and their course was bigger. And in general I spent 20 euros more, the course of my bank was 1 euro - 40 roubles, but they took 1 euro - 42.5 roubles. The staff couldn't say why I get such problem.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to celebrate my birthday”
Reviews.Author: z_rika
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights celebrating my birthday. We got a room at the 11th floor. the room is very comfotable, clean and airy. the location of the hotel is very good. as we did not include breakfast in our reservation we found the amstel station a good place to get food and drinks and we could also served ith within the refrigerator in our room. the transportation to the city as well as to and from the airport is excellent, frequent and cheap (we used 96h card for public transportation). the staff of the hotel was very helpfull and fulfilled all our needs. the only missing thing was a shower cap but it is neglectable. I truely recommend staying in Casa 400 at Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: CsabaS78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good choice if you'd like to visit Amsterdam and you'd like to avoid the busy downtown but stay close to it. The staff was very helpful, the room was very clean and well equipped. We had an electric kettle and cups also and we got tea bags and instant caffee every day. The metro and train station is only a 4 minutes walk from the hotel, and you can get to the city centre in 10 minutes from there.

Reviews.Title: “A nice and positive surprise”
Reviews.Author: Hallunder
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business functions. Was better than expected. A good choice when in Amsterdam. Location perfect for expos in RAI but quite from old city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised by this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FoolishJumper
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I was a bit reluctant as quite a few of the reviews were not very good, but it was a busy weekend (Hemelvaart) so I didn't have much choice. Arrival was easy; the train come directly into Amsterdam Amstel station, which is about 3 minute walk from the hotel. The station also is a stop for the #12 tram (going to the Museumplein and connecting to numerous other trams into every part of the city) and the night bus from the center. All-in-all, quite well connected to Amsterdam. The hotel itself was very nice. The speed of check-in was a tad slow, but after that I was extremely happy with the hotel. The rooms were spacious and very nice, particularly since the hotel is only a year old. I'd certainly stay in this hotel again if I'm in Amsterdam, which I'm sure I will be!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently location + a cheerful staff + a new property = an excellent place to stay in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: katravel51
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Casa 400, in operation about one year, is conveniently located near a train station and some excellent small cafes. The cheerful staff happily answered our "tourist" questions and shared information helpful about the neighborhood. The property is only about a year old and well maintained. The rooms are light and airy while the beds with lovely linens are very comfortable. Each day we took the train into Amsterdam to walk and enjoy the city returning to the quiet of our beautiful hotel. The Hotel Casa 400 is an exceptional value whether on business or pleasure when visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel (a bit out of the busy city)”
Reviews.Author: jeanvabu
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel but found it to be a bit outside of the city center for our liking. It is very close to Amstel station so that was quite helpful to get about. The room was very clean and modern. We found the staff to be quite helpful. The breakfast was always good. We ate dinner one evening at the restaurant (Circles) and found it to be tasty but a bit over priced. All in all a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, new, tidy, friendly - a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: miraclees
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam on a short tourist trip for four nights and were looking for a nice mid-range hotel to stay in. We usually spend the days sightseeing so we are looking for hotels to sleep in, not to stay in for all day. On such trips we usually aim for 3-star hotels like the Ibis brand. The Casa is brand-new (opened in 2010), the rooms are spotless clean, the reception staff was friendly and professional. The double bed was large enough for both of us to sleep comfortably and quite long which was welcome for a 6'2'' person like me. The description of the rooms provided on the hotel website was accurate for our room. Complimetary tea/coffee (electric kettle, cups, teabags, instant coffee) is included in room. WiFi is also complimentary and worked well. We did not have breakfast in the hotel so I can't comment on that. The hotel is in a quiet area and was quiet in general, so I would say that you can expect a good sleep. The hotel is in business area near Amstel station (5 minute walk). If you come as a tourist and are interested in the centre of the city, you can get there from the Amstel station by taking the metro or the train, or you can be like the locals and rent a bike (which is what we did and enjoyed it and from the hotel you get to the center in 15 minutes). Overall, I rate it very highly and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet place next to the canal”
Reviews.Author: deepalikapoor
Reviews.Content: This place was 3 stops by train from the city centre. We were there for the Easter weekend and the city centre was bustling with people so this was a great place to get away in the evenings and hang out at their bar or take a walk by the canal. The rooms were cheerful but service was a little slow. The staff at the front desk were extremely helpful and they directed us to all the sightseeing places including restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Labhunter71
Reviews.Content: My family and i had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Casa 400 recently and thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel staff were incredibly helpful and friendly during the check in. The crib for our two year old twins was already in the room when we arrived. Underground parking was spacious and reasonably priced at 16 Euro per day. We actually enjoyed not being in the city center so that we could have a quiet evening. Or as least as quiet as two year olds allow. It was a short and easy walk to Amstel Station where we could hop on the Metro and go anywhere we wanted to go. My only complaint was the price of the breakfast. 15 Euro per person for cheese, meats, breads, etc. which was way too much for us so we did not partake. We thought it should have been free. Either way though, we had a good time there and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: lhjelm
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is clean but the service level is very bad. They charged my credit card but said that it didn't work and charged in cash as well in the hotel bar. We were two friends but got a double bed without an extra blanket. They took the towels for laundry but did not replace them. This continues for all service related services throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern clean hotel, easy access to city and on site parking”
Reviews.Author: WayoutwestTruro
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights and wish I could have stayed longer. The hotel is bright, clean and modern with a great restaurant on site. The bed in our double room was massive with a lovely shower and tea and coffee facilities in the room. The on-site parking (16 euros a day) was a great advantage and Amstel station is a short walk away. The hotel is located in what feels like a nice quiet safe area. I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: amboseli
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this trendy hotel. We had a room on the 7th floor (no noise from the street) that was not very large but with every comfort one might need. The private parking is a real plus here, and the cost is very reasonable. We found the breakfast to be rather expensive at 15 euro per person, but with our booking through Vakantieveilingen.nl we paid far less than the normal rate for our room. We also found the location to be perfect. No city noise and only a 10 min. train or tram ride to the city centre. Whenever we go back to Amsterdam, we will certainly stay at Casa 400 again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: tillyhorn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double room on the 6th floor for one night in early March 2011. Booked through Booking.com for 70 Euros. City tax (~5%) was not included in the price and was paid on arrival. Do be aware that the location of this hotel is a little bit outside the city centre but we did not find this much of an issue because the city features an impressive public transport infrastucture and you get to all the major sights by a combination of tram and metro. You can reach the Casa 400 very easily from the central train station by using the metro line to Amstel Station; the hotel is just under 5 minutes walk from there. Taxi cost 25 Euros. We were informed it would take around 45 minutes to walk the distance. In my opinion I would say that the hotel itself was comparable to a larger version of a Holiday Inn Express/Premier Inn that you would find in the UK. The room was clean and modern with a mini-bar and flat-screeen TV. The double bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was a decent size with a good shower. The room did have air-conditioning but we didn't get the chance to test it. One thing that did concern us when we arrived was the adjacent building site. There was a note on the sideboard that explained there could be morning noise but they did supply earplugs! No noise was encountered during our stay, possibly because it was a Saturday. The staff all spoke English and were very friendly. Breakfast was not included with our booking - this was 15 Euros extra. We were also offered a dinner reservation when we checked-in with the incentive of a free drink. In all I would recommend this hotel; it would be ideal for those on a city break.

Reviews.Title: “When in Amsterdam, Casa 400 is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Septimiu
Reviews.Content: Hotel Casa 400 has a nice architecture and wonderful designed interiors. It is opened very recently, the staff is very friendly, they treat you as 5star guests! I enjoyed the stay very much!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustinaK_
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Contacting the center of a very simple and close to the hotel. The room we lived in a perfect (no noise from outside). The hotel offered a wide variety of food and so tasty. Receptionists very helpful. Price in line with the proposed service. I recommend this hotel ;)

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: steven00169
Reviews.Content: very clean and modern hotel, with excellent customer services and helpful staff. don't foget to get a city map published by the hotel, highly recommended place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for star rating - very clean, spacious and economical. Make sure you call the hotel to book - we got much better pri”
Reviews.Author: Saibhe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights while stopping over in Amsterdam - great find from reviews on here. The hotel is a little outside Amsterdam but in a nice safe area and easily accessible via the nearby amstel train station. It lacks a little bit of character but to be expected in a large hotel. Very reasonable rates and I'd rather the commute than choosing a city centre hotel, given the differences in standards we saw. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, well priced hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lisaw960
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for the price we paid. Very clean, modern building. Staff were very friendly and helpful. It's a little out of town but a 2 minute walk to the Metro Station and only 3 stops to Centraal Station. We stayed on a weekend and it was very quiet, although there is a building site outside the hotel which could cause some disturbance through the week. That said, the hotel provide earplugs next to your bed with an apologetic notice about the building work. The only bad thing I can say about this hotel is that the room was far too hot and the air con controls were very difficult to work out. The receptionist told us this was because it is an Eco System and you can only adjudt it -/+ 3 degrees. We did write it on the questionairre and were told that these comments do get listened to! Good standard basic hotel, and for the price we will definately stay there again on our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Casa 400 - recommended”
Reviews.Author: RufatAbas
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with nice staff and great service. Clean and comfortable rooms. Recommend with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Great for on a budget”
Reviews.Author: leeroyb
Reviews.Content: Pretty cheap hotel near Amstelstation 15/20 minutes from central amsterdam. Clean and new feeling, would be nice to have breakfast included as standard

Reviews.Title: “A-maz-ing!!”
Reviews.Author: Dons24
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for the weekend for his 30th birthday. I booked the hotel the night before our flight on lastmin and got it for Â£40 per night, exceptional value. T The hotel is a 2 min walk from Amstel station, there you can get the metro straight to central station (4 stops). The public transport is excellent we paid 20 euros for a 72hr travelcard, which you can use for everything, train, tram, metro and buses. The hotel is brand new, very clean and comfortable. The bed was so comfomy. The shower was really good too. Tea and coffee facility, hairdryer, mini fridge, safe, flat screen tv. It's got everything you need and it really didn't matter not being in the centre, intact I wouldn't have wanted to stay right in the hustle and bustle of it. It litterally took 15 mins to get into town. Would recommend this hotel to anyone, families, couples it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal In Amsterdam!!!”
Reviews.Author: irishposer
Reviews.Content: Its a little off the beaten path but so worth it!!! You don't get all the crazy city noise and is a five minute walk from the metro that will connect you to all over Amsterdam!! And the Metro Runs very late if you are night owl like us! The staff was very friendly. The only downfall is that it is a little ways from the tourist areas of Amsterdam so you have to prepare for that, but its not that bad! Worth the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: dianam_11
Reviews.Content: This is a very modern hotel, with large and clean rooms. A man in metro station gave us a paper with all the directions to come here ( made by the hotel), so, it was very easy to get there. Perfect quality-price. Good work, Hotel Casa-400. I would only recomend a cheapest option of the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel but service was hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: Fran3Leeds
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for a weekend break in Amsterdam and we thought it was fine. We were looking to stay in a hostel but left it too late to get anything in the centre of town for less that $50 each a night so we decided to look at hotel prices and saw a good discount for a last minute stay here. The rooms were a lot nicer than anything we would have got from a hostel - basic but clean and nicely set out and new feeling with tea and coffee facilities. I didn't find the hotel noisy at all. It is not difficult to find if you print off a map or directions before you come and get the metro or train to Amstel station. We decided to hire bikes from the hotel and this was the best desicion we made - cycling in Amsterdam is an amazing experience (especially when you are used to UK cities) and being in a hotel a bit far out (about 5 minutes on the bikes) was the perfect excuse to cycle. The cycle hire is a little expensive by Amsterdam standards but the convenience and underground storage at the hotel make up for this. On the Saturday night one of our bikes broke and when we got back to the hotel (at about 2am) we thought we should tell someone on reception - this man was extremely unhelpful!!! We decided he wasn't worth trying to talk to and we'd to sort it out in the morning. The next morning we spoke to a lady who was also very unhelpful (and quite rude!) but we asked to talk to someone else and the next lady we talked to couldn't help us enough - she sorted everything out for us and gave us a good discount on the bike hire (the lady we previously talked to had told us that we wouldn't get any money off and that we would have to pay a lot of money if the bike was broken!). I would stay here again - the cycling into and out of town again made us feel like locals and we saw a lot more of the city than we would have done on foot. Most of the staff we dealt with were very helpful but unfortunately there are a couple of staff members that are unhelpful and rude.

Reviews.Title: “New and funky”
Reviews.Author: CoralH18
Reviews.Content: It's brand new, love the room design and modern furniture. I got the bargain from venere.com (80 euro) so was given a corner room but thrilled to see the river thru the windows. It's not in city centre but only 5 mins walk to the train and another 10-15 mins to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Cold and noisy”
Reviews.Author: Just_A_Random_Guy
Reviews.Content: Stay here if you enjoy being woken up by noisy students returning late to this building, which doubles up as halls of residence, for the nearby university. I can also guarantee the added bonus of police sirens wailing past the hotel at all hours of the night, there is a police station on the same road. The air conditioning seems to work in parts of the hotel, in the parts that it does not work, like conference rooms, the restaurant, and bedrooms it is cold. It is not that easy to find, if you are walking from Amstel station, so ask an native or follow some one that looks like a student. This place is out of the way, two trains from the airport, I only stayed here on account of attending meetings in the hotel, the only plus is that the evening food was good compared to lunch.

Reviews.Title: “unwelcome and non accommodating”
Reviews.Author: SligoRose
Reviews.Content: I havent stayed in this hotel but I am very Disappointed from a business point of view . I am irish - working in Manchester. My two sisters are also working in London. We are going to Amsterdam this weekend for a family occasion. i booked this hotel on Saturday last-Nov. 13. Unfortunately, I cancelled on Monday morning but I was not given a pennyj refund. I didnt realize that there was such a thing as a non refundable booking- there is in this hotel.So I would not recommend a non refundable hotel to any potential visitor. I am very disappointed with their policy. My potential visit to Amsterdam has been very much put in dissaray as I feel policies like this arent exactly welcoming.If the staff are as inflexible and as tight fisted as their policies I woudl give this hotel a red star. customeres beware and make sure you read the small print. irish visitor

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clear”
Reviews.Author: chrisdim1612
Reviews.Content: nice, new and design hotel!5 minute walk from the metro amstel station but if you have big luggage its a bit of a problem. room clean and comfortable. breakfast very simple and expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mel_papaioannou
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was perfect. Location was great near Amstel Station just 2 minutes away by foot. Also the hotel was very clean and very helpfull staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: wlodek23
Reviews.Content: A nice and cozy hotel in a good location close by Amstel Train/Metro station which makes traveling to the city centre very comfortable and fast. The rooms are clean with TV (many English and German-speaking channels, some French ones too, and Dutch public TV), showers with toilet. The beds are quite nice, for me maybe a bit to soft. Staff is helpful and friendly. Free fast WiFi in the whole hotel is great. No room service, bar open until 12 am and poor breakfast choice are the cons of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: emma385
Reviews.Content: I went here from September 2nd to the 5th and it was quite a nice stay. The hotel was really nice, very modern and the staff were very helpful however the walls were like paper and we could hear everything going on in the rooms on either side and from the corridor. The location was a bit of a let down because theres isn't much to do unless you get a metro to Centraal Station but that only takes 10 minutes and all day travel tickets were really cheap. All there was really of any interest was a Burger King and a coffeeshop near to the hotal but apart from that we had a brilliant weekend!

Reviews.Title: “OK. But could be so much better...”
Reviews.Author: daveybear
Reviews.Content: Once you find the entrance, first impressions are of a hotel which is above the 3 star rating. There are signs from the Amstel station (very convenient), but finding the entrance can be interesting. The rooms are basic, but clean and comfortable (which you would expect from a hotel so new), though tea and coffee making facilities would be a real asset.In fact it's the little touches like that that let the hotel down and frustrate, because it could be so much better. The lifts in a morning are horrendous, We were on the third floor and waited 10 minutes before deciding to go up to go down and the beakfast, despite being give a "Special Offer Discount" upon arrival were basic and definitely did not cater for vegetarians with anything cooked. In summary, comparing with the prices of other Amsterdam hotels, although slightly out of the centre (access via trams and trains is excellent), it just about cuts it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: antoniobenforte
Reviews.Content: We have had a good stay in this hotel. Large room and bed, excellent reception service. We didn't have breakfast couse too expensive, but it wasn't a problem for us. The hotel is not in the center of the city but it is easily attainable by bus 59 or train (Amstelstation).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: pooria
Reviews.Content: Everything is ok. Quiet, clean and bright room with new facilities. Ultra high speed internet connection. TV with great channels. Helpful staff. reasonably price. Overall, I recommend this hotel. The only negative points from my point of view are :there is not any tool to show waiters that your room does not need to clean up. A bit far from city center but thanks to great amsterdam transportation system there is no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not the place for sleeping!”
Reviews.Author: Skyjoy
Reviews.Content: While the rooms were ok, the value stops there! In the summer it was hot, no fans available and only a small window vent. The vent could not be opened because some guest were allowed to party, loudly in front of the hotel until 2-3 am each morning. Would find guests or some people sitting or laying in the floors near elevators or guestrooms. After returning to a "cleaned" room, we found an eyebrow ring and extra dirty towel along with hair (not ours) on the vanity/sink. One morning the dining area had food crushed in a big area on the floor. The elevators are extremely slow and people are allowed to overcrowd them. IT WAS HORRIFIC! We cut out stay short with them and would never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jay1981Stockholm
Reviews.Content: New built hotel with nice clean rooms. Breakfast quite expensive but okey. Warm rooms with no ac, but u can borrow a fan at the reception (limited amouunts of fans, my friends didnt get any). Staff ok, no more no less. ~1h walk in to central amsterdam, 7min by metro, ~20 euro with cab.

Reviews.Title: “NICE, MODERN, ROOMY, ECONOMIC”
Reviews.Author: max1975
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. Reception service was excellent. They helped us with reservations, train and tram time schedules, and when our internet tv broke they did everything to fix it. They also offered to change room but we decided to keep the one they gave us. The room was clean, had a nice view, a lot of light. Very modern, minimalist, nice clean big bed. Big bathroom, with new hansgrohe faucets. The location was AMSTEL station. It was quiet, not downtown, but good located 1 block away from the metro and train station. What I liked best was the service and the hotel. What I liked least was the TV problem, which they offered to solve anyway.

Reviews.Title: “satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: AmidaMadrid
Reviews.Content: I was there for the weekend with my younger friends. Hotels in Amsterdam are quite expensive, but this place was very nice for the price. The breakfast buffet very expensive, but high quality. Rooms are big and VERY CLEAN. There is an ice dispenser on each floor. The are is not far from the center. It is possible to rent a bike (23 euros/2 days) and cicle to the center within 15 minutes along the river side....very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Someone stole my money”
Reviews.Author: brightsunhere
Reviews.Content: The stay would have been decent. The hotel is new so it is pretty fresh. On our second day I put most of my stuff from my handbag in my camera bag. All of it couldn't fit so I put out some of my discount cards for some clothing companies and some other cards that would be useless to steal. I also had a small purse with 300 danish crowns (DKK) in bills and some more in coins. I thought for myself, who would steal 300 DKK?
