Also as we were checking in, the lady in the reception talked a lot of their great security, that is you can only access the floors by the elevator if you have a key card. So I left my little purse in the handbag and took everything else of value with me. When we came back the housekeeping person had cleaned the room and moved everything, the purse, the cards I had put on the desk, my little papers (useless for anyone but me) and my make up that also were on the desk. I thought it was peculiar, because normally housekeeping people don't move anything they just take out the garbage, make the bed and clean in the bathroom. I didn't check my purse, though. The day after we checked out and made our way home by car. As we crossed the danish border I discovered that only the danish coins were left in the purse. Also conveniently for the thief, the yellow plastic bag with the receipt from forex. With the receipt you can exchange back without paying a fee. I feel really disappointed. Not as much for the money. I can live with losing 300 DKK. The memory of the trip is not as pleasant afterwards. I also suspect that somebody working at the hotel took the money, since I at all other locations had everything with me at all time during the trip. But if you work at the hotel and steal, is it really worth the risk? I find it rather unlikely that a hotel guest or somebody from outside had broken into my room and taken the money. So no, I would not recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Cool new & hip hotel - great value”
Reviews.Author: rvandun
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight here last weekend and had a great stay. The building is brand new, modern and pretty hip. Nice rooms, excellent quality bed and shower. Easy accessible by car, need to take a bike or tram into the city centre. Good price for this time of year in the city.

Reviews.Title: “It's new, it's cheap but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Jasperw
Reviews.Content: This is the new Casa 400 in Amsterdam. Casa 400 is a Amsterdam landmark, but the new one....No, it's just to noisy on the rooms....You can here everything from outsite and inside.

Reviews.Title: “Once construction will be done it will be fine, but it is out of the way”
Reviews.Author: HolaGatitos
Reviews.Content: This is your basic budget hotel with some nice little flourishes, but as another reviewer has noted there is a lot of construction and this is not good. One day there was a path to the front door, the next day it had been removed and was replaced with a board over some sand. This hotel used to be located a few blocks away so cab drivers can get quite confused when looking for the hotel. Also, if you stay here expect a 15 minute walk to the nearest tram or, if you follow the Amstel River you can walk from downtown in about 30-35 minutes. Not a great location, but the rooms are clean and a good size considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book here until they've finished the construction work”
Reviews.Author: Travellingmouse6
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel which I'm sure will be really lovely once they have finished the exterior which is currently sand, barriers and construction vehicles. Definitely not suitable for young children or disabled people. Entrance is at the back so you have to walk right through the building site to enter. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: s46
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a very good value for money. It was 5 min walk from the Amstel station which has connections to all the places. Amsterdam city center is about 15-20 mins by Tram.Schipol is around 20 mins by train.The hotel has been recently redecorated and was very clean.The room was spacious and had all the basic facilities.The food at the restaurant was very good though a bit expensive.The hotel staff was extremely helpful and cheerful.They provided us with all the information about the city , maps and directions. We would definitely go there again if we visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: jedixtine
Reviews.Content: This is a tourist hotel just out of the downtown area in Amsterdam. There is a metro station right across the highway from the hotel, just be sure to take the tunnel under the highway so you don't get reprimanded by the scooter police :) It was clean and functional. I went as part of a tour group. I would stay there again. Breakfast was included as part of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not really luxery, but OK if you are looking only for a place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: gregdechile
Reviews.Content: This hotel is neither sophisticated nor beatiful, but you can get a room with toilet for a rasonable price. It is not far from city centre and it is near to a bus station. The breakfast is good. Book this hotel only if you are thinking to use the hotel only for slepping.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, good location, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: cosyfeet
Reviews.Content: i visited Hotel Casa 400 with a group of girl friends on a weekend break, i honestly can not fault it! Ok its basic - but its clean, comfortable and the staff were lovely, we even dined in one evening - which again i cannot fault! for the money we paid, cannot complain at all - what do people expect?!?! if you want four star, pay the money for four star! The locations not bad either - a short trip on the metro to amsterdam city - which was pretty cheap too tbh. they didnt run very late but we always (some how) managed to find a bus to get back - they seemed to run to the early hours of the morning - brilliant - the bus took alot longer but again didnt bother us. would use the hotel again when we next visit without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very, very inferior!!”
Reviews.Author: sagethyme
Reviews.Content: When I got into the hotel, I got the impression the rooms were going to be reasonable. The recept area looked alright, and the building quite well maintained, so how bad can the rooms be right? Yeah, the rooms were appalling!! I thought I'd been given the keys to a backpackers! The walls were thin, door didn't feel securely shut. Carpet was filthy! I pulled my duvet over at night hoping I wouldn't wake up with bites the next day. Furnishings were old, broken or unfinished! Dirty walls. Bathroom? Don't even think too much about it, just go in, do what you need to do, and spend the rest of your time out! Pity Amsterdam was a let-down too.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: ILOVEHOLIDAYSYESIDO
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for what we required.. rooms are very basic but clean and although its near a main road you cannot hear it. The breakfast was pleasent, we did not eat dinner at the hotel, we ate out in the city centre each night. (please note if you eat out it is very expensive i.e. pint of beer 5 euros and a chicken tikka 19 euros without the rice or and extras!) Excellent very friendly staff, as soon as we arrived the gentleman on the front desk answered all our questions and advised us how to get back to the town centre. The metro station, train and tram are a 2 minute walk from the hotel which is great. The city centre is 3 stops on the metro about 5 mins. Although i would not advise to walk to the town centre from the hotel, it would probably take about 55 mins and everywhere looks the same, the maps make amsterdam look smaller than it is! The trams are reasonably cheap and sometimes they didnt make us pay, they let us get on as it was late at night. We fealt very safe walking around late at night. Although you have got the 2 main attractions (red light and cafes) its also worth taking a trip to the -8oc cafe where everything is made of ice and anne franks house is very interesting to, also the torture museam. There are some amazing shops if you go further out of the main centre, quite expensive though. BUT YES i would reccomend this hotel, its very cheap and reasonable, we were a group of 21-25 yr olds and it was just right for us. I would advice to get a taxi from the train station to the hotel if you dont feal comfortable getting a metro as its quite difficult to find unless you know where your going, its tucked away, will cost about 15 euros. But you can get the metro from central to station amstel and the hotel is 2 mins walk from there. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Although the rooms need updating and redecoration, the staff made up for it with their friendly and caring personalities”
Reviews.Author: DevonianRiddy
Reviews.Content: My elderly mother and I stayed there. The visit was unfortunately interrupted by her having an accident and breaking her shoulder in Amsterdam. On returning to the hotel from hospital, the staff were exceedingly helpful and couldn't do enough to make our situation as comfortable as possible until our return to the UK. The room however was basic and needed updating and redecorating. The location was alright for us as we could easily get to the station to go to Amsterdam Central. But I must emphsasise again the staff were excellent and provided top service.

Reviews.Title: “Hiliday with Young Children. CASA 400”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshire_Dad
Reviews.Content: It is an excellent hotel for the price. The staff is extreamly helpfull, courteous and friendly. Cleaning staff supervision and same breakfast menu needs attention, that does not mean poor, but can be improved..Location is spot on. Higly recomended by all means, would definately stay again.Very Very Good Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Magic1201
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Amsterdam airport, went to the tourist information point within the airport and paid for a map 3 Euros. went to the ticket service desk (follow the signs) and we paid 4 Euros each to get the metro. We got the train to Amstel, follow the signs to the Casa 400 hotel and when you first arrive at the hotel you will notice the building is located next to a school and the recepition looks very modern as does the bar etc. We were staying on the 8th floor (room 812), be warned the rooms are very warm as we got the sun on that side from 5am until early evening! (we left the room windows open all day and all night) The prices at the restaurant are little expensive but the bar prices for drinks are okay. Breakfast if good, not fried eggs or bacon am afraid but its a good start to the day. We arrived at the hotel on the Friday morning and department Sunday mid morning ( double check which train you get back to the airport! before borading). We purchased a 48 hour (2 day) GVB card 11 euros and 50 cent, purchased a 24 hour cancl bus (which have three routes, red, green and blue and take you around Amsterdam for 20 Euros) rmember to pick up one of there 'Fun hop on, hop off cancal cruise ' you will find discount vouchers in the back. If you are looking for a quick get away, have an open mind and are happy to sleep in what I would class this as a 2 star hotel - it will do. Amsterdam is cheap in places but you will have to hunt around for the cheap cafes etc as they will charge 9 euros for a beer and orange juice. If you like to serve the internet the hotel wil charge 10 Euros per day, if you need extra blankets and pillows you need to request from reception and there are no kettles in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for what we required!”
Reviews.Author: Burybabe1
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel, we were greeted with very friendly reception staff. Okay the rooms are basic and a little dated(but what do you expect for 54 year old hotel) The main thing was it was clean and the chambermaids did this EVERY morning! The bar staff were very friendly, although bar prices were a little expensive, but the surroundings were relaxing. We didn't go to spend 3 days in the hotel, so on the whole i was pleased with my choice, as we were 8 mins from the Stadium and 8 mins from the centre(by train) and this was perfect for us, although if i go back again the hotel will have moved(as they are building a bigger one) behind the police station- due to open in May 2010 & from pictures that were around it will be modern.

Reviews.Title: “Good for B&B”
Reviews.Author: Godnik
Reviews.Content: If you need to spend not more than INR 15000 for a 3 night stay including Dinner & Bar (to some extent), this is the best place to stay. Very close to the Amstel station (5 min walking). Not in a great area (It's in front of a Police station) though. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. Avoid using the pay phone situated in the lobby (they charge 20 cents extra) just to dial out. It's better to use it from the main street. Rooms are okay. They get cleaned everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bertenernieinchicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the weekend in hotel Casa400 because the roomrate was nice and we did not needed anything fancy. I have to say, the hotel + amenities are basic, the breakfast is a good overall continental breakfast, which is fine included in the price. Definately I can recommend staying here, because the staff go out of their way to help with directions, recommends good places to go for dinner/dance. It might not be that trendy, but hey you just need a bed, it is better to enjoy the service!

Reviews.Title: “I would draw a fair comparison to hotels in East Berlin in the 1960's.”
Reviews.Author: N.Davies
Reviews.Content: One of my worst experiences of hotels in Europe. Overpriced and overated as a 3 star, which it cerainly is not. Upsetting to arrive in a hotel after travelling so far and looking forward to some enjoyment in one of europe's top destination; Amsterdam. The whole hotel from reception to the 6the floor where we stayed was dreadfully in need of a complete overhall and refurbishment. I would draw a fair comparison to hotels in East Berlin in the 1960's. Lino in the corridors, formica fitments in the bedroom, iron 'hospital' bed, cracked windows, rundown bathroom. So out of date and run down I cannot believe someone has passed this off as a 3 star. The breakfast was simple and cheap. Bread and jam, some cold meats and cheese. No croissants or fresh orange or good coffee here. Very poor indeed. We stayed one night and checked out. How Last Minute can include this in their selection of city hotels in Amsterdam is astonishing. There are plenty of nice hotels closer to the centre and better priced than the Casa 400. Not recommended. Avoid at all costs. Don't be fooled by the photos.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Crapa 400 !”
Reviews.Author: Niknaknew
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very much like a film set , when you go behind the scene of the main stage , back stage is held together with string glue and four inch rusty nails! The beds were clean ,which after cycling 100 miles to get there was there only saving grace . Our room slept four ,we had an ensuite bathroom which had hard to get Italian tiles on the wall, they were that hard to get they had removed some from the" kitchen area" ! Which had mould growing in the fridge and around the worktops . Cheap but not clean . Breakfast was ok but rolls and meat coffee and tea not really hard for anyone to lay on , we kept to anything sealed in plastic or hot after seeing our kitchen area! The hotel should be used as a 1970's KGB gum set!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Woody86
Reviews.Content: A crowd of us stayed in this hotel when at a stag do in Amsterdam. It's a little bit outside Amsterdam Central but is fairly easy to get to via the Metro (station 5 mins away) or taxi (15 euros). The rooms are basic with 2 beds, a tv, fan and a bathroom with a shower. Beds were clean and comfortable and rooms were cleaned daily with towel changes too. The staff were helpful but had some issues where room keys were lost as they had been put in the slot for a totally different room at reception. We had breakfast at the hotel and this was simple continental breakfast of meats, eggs and bread with an array of juices. All in all, it suited us for a cheap weekend as we were not after anything fancy

Reviews.Title: “Whatever falls on the floor at the Casa stays on the floor...”
Reviews.Author: willteach4travel
Reviews.Content: I am a 27 year old female who stayed at the Casa will 2 other women. I stayed at the Casa 400 to kick of my two week European vacation. I was pleasently suprised by the lobby- it was clean and modern. My "happy" suprises ended there. My room was disgusting. The carpet looked as though it had never been shampooed and I had an alergic reaction the heavily starched sheets. I was disgusted by the room. As for the location- the location would have been nice if the nearby Amstel station was not undergoing massive construction. The hotel was also loud as there were many (very young- under 20s even) groups staying at the hotel. This hotel is for people who think they are too good for a hostel but are not!

Reviews.Title: “Just a bed and a shower”
Reviews.Author: ersinyx
Reviews.Content: It's about what you expect at your stay. I was looking for a cheap room, a clean bed and a shower. Yes! I got what I expected but then I realised that I missed something in my expectations, a decent wardrobe. Room hasn't got a wardrobe, so you have to keep your luggage almost packed. Location of the hotel is just a little walk from a big station called AmstelStation where you can go to anywhere you want in the city even to Belgium or Germany (I'm not kidding). I'd just recommend it for young Amsterdam lovers!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for stag nights”
Reviews.Author: Curtis_977
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a stag weekend. To be honest itâ€™s about all the hotel is good for. The room was basic with three â€˜z-bedsâ€™. The main problem is the fact that itâ€™s located in the middle of nowhere. A taxi to/from the centre is 13 to 15 euros. The metro train station is a short walk from the hotel and much cheaper. A group ticket for seven of us was 6.80 euros each way. On the plus side the beds were clean and the continental breakfast was okay (cold meats, juice, coffee, toast, cheese etc) Incidentally, breakfast was crowded both days. If I was going to Amsterdam again with my wife then I would definitely not stay here but if youâ€™re on a stag/hen night and you canâ€™t find anything nearer the centre that will take a group then I suppose itâ€™s okay.

Reviews.Title: “What a boring place!”
Reviews.Author: Richard35
Reviews.Content: Wanted to go to Amsterdam at the last minute. Got ourselves booked into the "Greenhouse Effect" for two nights but then had 1 night to find. (Saturday) Went to hotelrunners.com near the red light district and the young lady on the desk told us that the only hotel that they had was the casa 400. Well, we didn't have any choice. Hoped on the metro and 4 stops later got to our location. We walked around the large roundabout for a good half hour only to find out that had we gone around the roundabout a different way it would have taken us 2 minutes (Oh well!) The hotel looks like any other balkan state square thing stuck in the ground. Reception was nicely decked out and altough I had sampled some of Amsterdam finest, this didn't seemt o faze the receptionist. Room - square and boring - very very warm, although they gave us a fan. TV, ok but on the "desk" so not a good view here from the person who has the bed farthest away. Breakfast was ok. Hotel was clean (not cheap)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: caerleon
Reviews.Content: Not quite sure where to start with this hotel. As we didn't book the trip until late, we were limited on hotels to choose from. Eventually we settled on this due to the price. The first thing you notice is the size of the hotel. It used to be a big conference centre that has been changed to a hotel. They must have approximately 800 bedrooms. Due to arrival time at Schipol we got a taxi at approximate cost of 40 Euros. The impressions you get from outside, is Oh my god what have we booked, however check in was quick and effortless. The rooms are really basic, however were clean. There was no airconditioning but the rooms were supplied with a fan. My tip would be to request a room not overlooking the front of the building my friends mentioned they were constantly awake from noise of people getting back to the hotel at night and people leaving in the morning. I did not notice anything from the other side. We did have a snack at the bar, it wasn't the greatest of meals. Apparently to get into the centre by train is easy, however a we used taxis all weekend and paid 12-14 Euros a trip to get to Dam Square. I would use this hotel again if I was in a large group or was consious about the price of hotels in the centre. To sum up, the hotel is Ok the staff are good and helpful, the price is good. The rooms are basic and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for busy Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: SuzWilkinson
Reviews.Content: Good points: Good price, clean, efficient and friendly service, decent breakfast. Bad points: Not in the centre of the city. Amsterdam can be difficult to find cheap, decent accomodation. Casa 400 Hotel is only open in the Summer months to cater for the extra tourists. The rooms are basic but adequate. It is a 10 minute walk from Amstel station which is a station that all lines pass so you only have to wait about 7 minutes for a train. It is extraordinarily well sign posted (look across the square towards the climbing man). You have to pass through a tunnel which we found to be very well lit. It seemed darker during the day than at night! I would happily go back again if I couldn't find a place in the centre of the city at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price and clean”
Reviews.Author: Bob47
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Casa 400 twice since 2002. The reception staff are friendly and helpful and the security lockers are good. The rooms were compact and basic but they were also clean and more than adequate. When you bear in mind the price that you are paying the Casa 400 represents good value for money and peace and quiet compared to the hotels nearer the centre. Transportation was not a problem. Amstel station is on both the main line and the subway and with the "strippenkart" transport ticket it was easy to get around. I would definitely choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean & over priced restaurant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Casa 400 with 5 others for 3 nights at the beginning of September 2004. The rooms were basic - no tea and coffee facilities, however they were clean and there was a daily maid service. We had 2 rooms that slept three, I think the rooms were no larger than a twin - they had just stuck another bed in! The hotel itself is a little way from the city - BUT not too far, just a train ride away. The station is close so thats ok. (If you are staying a few nights and will be going in/out of city frequently get a strip train ticket to save money) The only actual 'downside' was the breakfast, I had not been to Holland before so I don't know if it was the standard but it was a COLD breakfast with yucky tea and coffee. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but the menu appeared expensive for the food available. I wouldn't rush back but its not a bad place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “It's not a hotel !”
Reviews.Author: SwanseaBoy68
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2001 - it looks like a 60's office block 'cos that's what it is !It's a conference centre and is only open to holiday guests during the summer - that's why it was so cheap.It is a metro trip into town - get a taxi back at night.Not recommended for ladies as not in a safe part of town - OK for a group of lads though

Reviews.Title: “good enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: clean hotel modern .rather boring area of town i.e dont hang about here .only a place to sleep and wash.rather dodgy dark underpass sort of tunnel to go under to reach amstel metro station to travel into town centre be wary at night its rather dark and poorly lit.metro sytem from here to town is first class for all that all in all a half decent place to stay but there are better nearer town for same money.last but not least especially if ur from uk dont expect much of a breakfast.strange cold meats and stuff .im maybe just too fussy.

Reviews.Title: “Casa 400 - Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Pigmeat
Reviews.Content: Located about 10 minutes by Metro from city centre in a not too pleasant area. No restaurants or bars close to the hotel. Slightly isolated, but Metro station about 10 minutes walk. Metro or taxi is essential. No A/C but large fans provided in the room to cool you off in high summer. Basic, clean rooms with simple furniture. Only ate breakfast in the hotel but it was adequate. Hotel popular with coach tour operators. When we arrived there were no towels provided, but a trip to hotel reception cured this. Would not go back as I'm sure there are better hotels nearer the city centre for the same cost. Looks like a 1960's office block with rooms to match.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Casa 400
HotelInfo.Address: Eerste Ringdijkstraat 4, Amsterdam 1097BC, The Netherlands
